description.p: The Moon is the most powerful beeing of the night sky. Some nights spending light. Some nights leave everyone in darkness. Many people envy the moon for the beautiful light shining from. A light not pure but also not tainted. Any magical creature can feel the magic of that light - especially warlocks. But only a few knew the truth.

The Lunar Queen actually is the one who sheds the magic coming from the moon, also gift some spellcaster a potion of her own power. But nobody should play with her kindness or harm her followers. It could not end well.

sheet.description: Your patron is the Moon... actually the Lunar Queen.

description.p: The Lunar Goddess lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

sheet.description: The Lunar Goddess lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you can surround you with moonlight. As a bonus action, you magically wreathe yourself in swirling moonlight. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.
Any creature takes radiant damage equal to your Charisma modifier if it hits you with a melee attack from within 5 feet of you or if it touches you.
Whenever you roll radiant damage on your turn, the roll gains a bonus to equal to your Charisma modifier. This only occurs once for an attack action or spell.

description.p: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short rest.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can vanish in a cloud of stars in response to harm. You can use your reaction at any time to move up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

sheet.description: You can vanish in a cloud of stars in beware of harm. You can use your reaction at any time to move up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

description.p: At 10th level the moon granted you a companion as a reward for your loyalty. You may choose between a Lunar Pixie, a Lunar Felidae or a Lunar Canis. You add half your proficiency bonus rounded down to the companions AC, attack roll, attack dmg, skills and saving throws that the companion is proficient in. It's max HP equals four times your Warlock level.
Whenever your companion attacks, add half your proficiency bonus rounded down to the companions attack roll and attack dmg.

Starting at 14th level, you can become a conduit of the Moon’s power with moonlight shining out of your eyes, allowing you to double your damage dices for one attack or spell. When using this feature any creature other than you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw against DC 15 or be frightened of you until the end of their next turn. Allied creatures who know you have advantage on this saving throw.
You can decide to use this feature before your attack roll.
You must finish a short or long rest before you can use this part of the feature again.

Additionally to this you and your Servant of the Moon may choose to let Spectral wings appear on your back, gaining a flying speed of 40 feet. You can use your Spectral Wings at any time regardless of the restriction for the first part of this feature.

sheet.description: When casting a spell you may double the damage dices for that cast. Any creature other than you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw against 15 or be frightened of you until the end of their next turn. Allied creatures who know you have advantage on this saving throw.

description.p: You have advantage on saving throws against the frightened condition. You can use your Light of the Moon feature once more per short rest and gain resistance against necrotic damage while it is active.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws against the frightened condition. While Light of the Moon is active you have resistance against necrotic damage.
